org.openadaptor.thirdparty.mq
Class MqConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.thirdparty.mq.MqConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent
public class MqConnection
extends Component

MqConnection is responsible for all interaction with MQ. It is responsible for making connections and actual reading and writing of data. It acquires XAResources for distributed transaction management and interacts with local transaction managers for local transaction management. MB this connection component is not shareable between Connectors.
Since IBMS's mq.jar is freely downloadable but not distributable direct access to the mq a non-functional stub-api has been mocked up. This allows openadaptor to build even in the absence of mq.jar. This is not ideal but avoids the necessity for conditional compilition being built into the build script.

convertOption

protected boolean convertOption
Request the application data to be converted, to conform to the characterSet and encoding attributes of the MQMessage, before the data is copied into the message buffer. Because data conversion is also applied as the data is retrieved from the message buffer, applications do not usually set this option.

_UK_US_EBCDIC_Switch

protected boolean _UK_US_EBCDIC_Switch
MQ character set switch. If true, and message character set is 285 UK EBCDIC, then switch to character set 37 US EBCDIC. This allows workaround if mq libraries do not support UK EBCDIC since numbers, letters, space, +, - and fullstop are all the same

connectionRetryInterval

protected long connectionRetryInterval

isUseLocalTransactions

public boolean isUseLocalTransactions()
Set to true to ensure that MQ is configure to start transactions on read/write. This allows Local Transaction Management to work. Default value is false.

Returns:
boolean

public void setUseLocalTransactions(boolean useLocalTransactions)

nextRecord

public java.lang.String nextRecord(long timeoutMs)
Fetch the next record off the message queue and return the content as a string.

Parameters:
timeoutMs - the amount of time to listen on the queue for a record. Zero or a negative number indicates that no wait will occur and will return immediately (with null if there is no message on the queue).
Returns:
String

createGetMessageOptions

protected void createGetMessageOptions()
Generate messageoptions for reading, taking transaction settings into account. Ideally this method is run just once but it is safe to rerun it.

createPutMessageOptions

protected void createPutMessageOptions()
Generate messageoptions for writing, taking transaction settings into account. Ideally this method is run just once but it is safe to rerun it.
